description: Evidence of authorization from competent authority to provide payment services, including the application, programme of operations, business plan, governance arrangements, internal control mechanisms, and risk assessment procedures
auditor_questions: Show me your authorization decision from the competent authority
What payment services are you authorized to provide?
Show me the programme of operations and business plan submitted with the authorization
How do you maintain ongoing compliance with authorization conditions?

maturity_levels.basic: Authorization obtained, basic compliance monitoring in place
maturity_levels.intermediate: Regular internal reviews of authorization compliance, documented change management process
maturity_levels.advanced: Continuous compliance monitoring, automated regulatory change tracking, proactive engagement with competent authority

description: Documentation of compliance with initial capital and ongoing own funds requirements for payment institutions, calculated using one of the three methods prescribed in Article 9, with regular reporting to competent authorities
auditor_questions: Show me your initial capital documentation and evidence it meets the required threshold
Which calculation method do you use for ongoing own funds requirements?
Show me quarterly own funds calculations and demonstrate continuous compliance
How do you project future capital needs based on business growth?

maturity_levels.basic: Capital requirements met, quarterly calculations performed
maturity_levels.intermediate: Monthly monitoring with early warning indicators, documented capital planning process
maturity_levels.advanced: Real-time capital monitoring, automated stress testing, forward-looking capital adequacy projections

description: Documented procedures for safeguarding funds received from payment service users or through other payment service providers, either by segregation in a separate account at a credit institution or investment in secure liquid low-risk assets, or coverage by an insurance policy or comparable guarantee
auditor_questions: Which safeguarding method do you use (segregation, insurance, or guarantee)?
Show me evidence of fund segregation from the payment institution's own funds
How do you ensure funds are not commingled with other clients' funds?
Show me the reconciliation process between client funds held and obligations to payment service users

maturity_levels.basic: Safeguarding method chosen and implemented, basic reconciliation performed
maturity_levels.intermediate: Daily reconciliation, independent verification, documented escalation procedures for discrepancies
maturity_levels.advanced: Real-time reconciliation, automated alerts for discrepancies, third-party attestation of safeguarding compliance

description: Logs of access to payment account information by account information service providers (AISPs), documenting consent obtained, data accessed, and security measures applied during each access
auditor_questions: Show me how consent is obtained before account information is accessed
What authentication mechanisms are used for account information access?
Show me access logs including timestamps, data requested, and AISP identity
How do you ensure only the data consented to is shared with the AISP?

maturity_levels.basic: Access logs maintained with consent records
maturity_levels.intermediate: Granular consent management, automated access monitoring, anomaly detection
maturity_levels.advanced: Real-time access monitoring with AI-driven anomaly detection, consent dashboards for payment service users

requirement_summary: Rights and obligations in relation to the authorization and use of payment instruments
description: Documentation of terms and conditions governing the issuance and use of payment instruments, including the respective obligations of the payment service provider and the payment service user regarding safekeeping, notification of loss, and liability allocation
auditor_questions: Show me the terms and conditions provided to payment service users for payment instruments
How are users informed of their obligation to keep personalized security credentials safe?
What is the notification procedure when a payment instrument is lost, stolen or misappropriated?
How do you handle blocking of payment instruments and what are the notification requirements?

maturity_levels.basic: Terms and conditions documented and provided to users, basic notification procedures
maturity_levels.intermediate: Multi-channel notification options, automated instrument blocking, clear liability framework
maturity_levels.advanced: Real-time fraud detection triggering automatic blocking, proactive user communication, AI-driven risk assessment

description: Documented procedure for handling unauthorized payment transactions, including immediate refund obligations (by end of next business day), investigation process, liability allocation rules, and the EUR 50 maximum payer liability for unauthorized transactions involving compromised security credentials
auditor_questions: Show me your procedure for handling unauthorized transaction claims
How do you ensure refunds are issued by the end of the next business day?
What investigation process do you follow to determine liability?
Show me evidence of the EUR 50 liability cap being applied correctly in past cases

maturity_levels.basic: Refund procedure documented, basic investigation process in place
maturity_levels.intermediate: Automated refund processing within SLA, structured investigation workflow with audit trail
maturity_levels.advanced: Real-time fraud detection reducing unauthorized transactions, automated liability assessment, predictive analytics for dispute patterns

requirement_summary: Security measures for operational and security risks
description: Policy establishing mitigation measures and control mechanisms to manage operational and security risks relating to payment services, including security measures to protect confidentiality and integrity of personalized security credentials
auditor_questions: Show me your operational and security risk management policy for payment services
What specific security measures protect the confidentiality of personalized security credentials?
How do you perform risk assessments for your payment service operations?
Show me evidence of regular security testing and vulnerability assessments

maturity_levels.basic: Security risk policy documented, basic controls implemented
maturity_levels.intermediate: Regular risk assessments, penetration testing, security monitoring with incident response
maturity_levels.advanced: Continuous security monitoring, automated threat intelligence integration, red team exercises, DevSecOps pipeline

description: Log of all major operational or security incidents reported to the competent authority without undue delay, including initial notification, interim reports, and final root cause analysis, plus aggregated statistical data on fraud submitted at least annually
auditor_questions: Show me the incident reporting log with all major operational and security incidents
What is your timeline for notifying the competent authority of a major incident?
Show me an example of a complete incident report including root cause analysis
How do you classify incidents to determine reporting obligations?

maturity_levels.basic: Incident log maintained, competent authority notified for major incidents
maturity_levels.intermediate: Structured incident classification, automated notification workflow, root cause analysis for all major incidents
maturity_levels.advanced: Real-time incident detection and automated classification, predictive incident analytics, continuous improvement feedback loop

description: Test results demonstrating that strong customer authentication is applied when the payer accesses their payment account online, initiates an electronic payment transaction, or carries out any remote action that may imply a risk of payment fraud, using two or more independent elements from knowledge, possession, and inherence categories
auditor_questions: Show me your SCA implementation and which authentication factors are used
How do you ensure independence of the two authentication elements?
What dynamic linking mechanism do you use for electronic payment transactions?
Show me test results demonstrating SCA compliance across all required transaction types

maturity_levels.basic: SCA implemented with two independent factors, basic testing performed
maturity_levels.intermediate: Comprehensive test coverage, transaction risk analysis for exemptions, regular review of authentication methods
maturity_levels.advanced: Adaptive authentication with real-time risk scoring, biometric factors, continuous SCA compliance monitoring across all channels

requirement_summary: Regulatory technical standards for authentication and communication
artifact_name: RTS Compliance Documentation for SCA and Communication
description: Documentation demonstrating compliance with the EBA regulatory technical standards on strong customer authentication and common and secure open standards of communication, including dedicated interface specifications for account access
auditor_questions: Show me your compliance assessment against the EBA RTS on SCA and CSC
What dedicated interface do you provide for third-party provider access?
How do you ensure the interface performs at the same level as the customer-facing interface?
Show me the SCA exemptions you apply and the transaction risk analysis supporting them

maturity_levels.basic: Dedicated interface implemented, basic SCA exemptions documented
maturity_levels.intermediate: Performance monitoring of dedicated interface, comprehensive exemption framework with transaction monitoring
maturity_levels.advanced: Real-time interface performance parity monitoring, adaptive exemption thresholds based on fraud analytics, API developer portal with sandbox
